trans-unit.source: Represents the base class for all exceptions caused by evaluation or validation of rules.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException"></xref> class.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException>.
Property
Value
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
A system-supplied localized description.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance using the `message` parameter.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException>.
Property
Value
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The error message string.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during de-serialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException"></xref> class, with a specified error message and a reference to the inner <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that is the cause of this <xref href="System.Exception"></xref>.

An <xref:System.Exception> that is thrown as a direct result of a previous <xref:System.Exception> should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference (`Nothing`) if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner <xref:System.Exception> value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleException>.
Property
Value
The inner <xref:System.Exception> reference.
The error message string.
The message that describes the error.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that is the cause of the current <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> .
If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), the current is raised in a catch block that handles the inner .
